title: November's almost here..
content: And it's about time for the beginning of [url=http://nanowrimo.org]National Novel Writing Month[/url], I hope I'm not the only one here that'll be writing a book for it.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
Neat; I'll talk to my class about it - We can write up that book we were talking about. I must talk to them first.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
Nawaja... this isn't a book... it is a novel. 500,000 in 30 days. Trust me... it is a LOT.

My brother did it 2 YEARS now and is going for a THIRD. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] Last year, I didn't try to write a book but I did wright some of a story. It was an alternate reality set in World War 1 era. I still like the idea bit this year I am going in a Scfi direction. I doubt that I can do 500,000 words out of the story I have. And besides... my writing is so bad it would make you cry before finishing the first chapter.

Hey... Is anyone going to do a Keen fanfic for Nanowimo? Eh... maybe it would be best not to.-----------------------
"Tough guys wear pink"
[img]http://img455.imageshack.us/img455/8978/mod21gb.jpg[/img]
"But fat people buy lots"

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] A Keen NaNo? That sure would be neat but not sure if I write that.

Either the way, thanks for reminding me xtra, I'm going to write one, I hope.

So, what do I do?! Do I need to register on the site or what? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
50'000 words in 30 days?

Thats only 5'000 in 3 days, little over 1'600 words a day. One person could do that, 30 easily. Heck, I could even submit my fanfic [it has about 30'000 words in it.] although its references to the PCKF and Keen would probbably harm its sellability. A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
One of the rules is that you need to make a new story. Although it doesn't matter if you continue on something already started. You just aren't supposed to do that. What am I saying?

Moving on... I think that it would be cool if you got your fan fiction to 50,000 words. All it needs is a little rewriting and um... a through spell checking.

Anyone else doing it?-----------------------
"Tough guys wear pink"

"But fat people STILL buy lots"

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
I'll start writting... is there any word limit; we just had a creative writting contest, and I exeaded the word limit (350), in around 20 minutes!!!

Ilsoap; just get started - if you don't finish, you can submit it next year.

BTW - Is there some prize, or something?

title: Re: November's almost here..
content:
50,000 words minimum. Get writing! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

(The focus in on quantity as opposed to quality. You could write out 175 pages of rubbish, but you probably wouldn't feel very proud of doing so.)[url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]
[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]
